channel.title: Jar files wont work
channel.description: how come when i try to run a jar file with javaw like im suposed to, i get an error saying that it cannot find the main class, which is the same file that worked before i had to re-install windows? please help lol

item.title: Jar files wont work
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Well vista may be shit but it still shouldn’t cause that problem, since you just installed it make sure your computer has the latest updates, most of the time it takes 2-3 days for windows to tell you that there is a newer service pack available.

Read full topic

item.title: Jar files wont work
item.dc:creator: @prison190 prison190
item.description:
@prison190 wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:9, topic:407135”][quote author=prison190 link=topic=508428.msg3688477#msg3688477 date=1311979897]

If you have Winrar or 7zip you can extract the files, and there should be “/meta-inf/manifest.mf” file. Open it with notepad or any text editor, and it should have a Main-Class: entry.

[code]Manifest-Version: 1.0
Main-Class: main

[/code]

that is what was in there, like i said this used to work until i had to re-install windows =/
[/quote]
What version of windows did you install?[/quote]

It worked when I had Windows 7 then I had to go back to Windows Vista home premium 64 bit

Read full topic

If you have Winrar or 7zip you can extract the files, and there should be “/meta-inf/manifest.mf” file. Open it with notepad or any text editor, and it should have a Main-Class: entry.
[/quote]

[code]Manifest-Version: 1.0
Main-Class: main

[/code]

that is what was in there, like i said this used to work until i had to re-install windows =/[/quote]
What version of windows did you install?

item.title: Jar files wont work
item.dc:creator: @prison190 prison190
item.description:
@prison190 wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:4, topic:407135”][quote author=prison190 link=topic=508428.msg3688446#msg3688446 date=1311978676]

  1. i didnt make the jar 2. it worked before and now it wont work? your post was pointless
    [/quote]

Sorry, your badly constructed original post doesn’t give to much information to work from. My post did have a point because now I know that you did not create the JAR, which you should have stated in the first place. You give us no information about it whatsoever.

Open the JAR with an archive manager and see if the manifest has a correct Main-Class entry.[/quote]

sorry, and how do i do that? =o

Read full topic

Open the JAR with an archive manager and see if the manifest has a correct Main-Class entry.
